turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Rrgh mmffpprr brghuh!!

turns.speaker: ZEDD
turns.text: How dare you?!  Nobody shuts up Rita but me!

turns.speaker: ZEDD
turns.text: Isn't this just TYPICAL!  We finally do somebody a good turn and just look what happens!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: From now on it's E-V-I-L, NO exceptions!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I hope those Rangers put that lousy lowlife out of his misery!

turns.speaker: ZEDD
turns.text: GO POWER RANGERS!

turns.speaker: ZEDD
turns.text: That was a CHEAP shot!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: We couldn't have done it better ourselves.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Anybody see them?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Activating Power Scope!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: How the heck?!...

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: What's going on?!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Six become one... the combined forces of the Ninjetti.

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: Strength in numbers!!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: I am the mighty ape!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: And I am the Falcon, Winged Lord of the Sky!

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: THREE SECONDS!!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: LET'S DO IT!?

turns.speaker: ROCKY
turns.text: NINJA APE ZORD!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: NINJA FALCON ZORD!

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: There seems to be some confusion about your registration. I believe I can find you a place at the Ambassador. Many persons of the Jewish faith find it quite...

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: I ain't no fuckin' kike!

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir. Our clientele is restricted to White Anglo-Saxons.

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: And I ain't no nigger either!

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Sir, we do not use such names at our hotel.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: You own a hotel, sir?

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: The Bismark in Chicago. You familiar?

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: What you're sayin' makes a lotta sense. Ya know, if I keep on killin' people like I have, I won't have no more friends left!

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You've got the public upset, Al.

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: But you know I never killed nobody that didn't deserve it.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: When the people get so upset, our politician friends gotta listen.

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: What are ya tellin' me, Charlie?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: We're asking you to go to prison.

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: But I've never served a day.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: If it wasn't important for everybody, we wouldn't ask. We got friends in Philly. They can send you up for a couple months on a weapons charge.

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: Awwh, Charlie.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Minimum security. You'll have everything but broads.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: So Chicago's been good to ya.

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: I do right by Johnny Torrio and he does right by me.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Ya still owe me fifty bucks for the train ticket.

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: And a lot more. Can we talk?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Sure. What's with the brick wall?

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: Since Colosimo bit it, I gotta keep an eye out for his friends.

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: One fuckin' year ago I had ta hit you up for train fare. Now I can buy the fuckin' train. And I ain't even a fuckin' Sicilian!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: But ya got a Boss.

turns.speaker: AL CAPONE
turns.text: Torrio ain't like them guys. He thinks like an American. You'd like him, Charlie. He'd like you.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Maybe. But he'd still be the Boss.

turns.speaker: BOBBY CLOWES
turns.text: I'm Bobby Clowes. Kansas City.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Charlie Luciano.

turns.speaker: BOBBY CLOWES
turns.text: You ever been near a meat packing plant? My father makes a couple million per, but the smell in his office is enough to make you puke.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Got the same problem with my pop -- garlic. Nothin' you can do.

turns.speaker: BOBBY CLOWES
turns.text: The goddamned bastards.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Tell me about it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY CLOWES
turns.text: I remember reading a poem in college. "Sicily. Poor, noble isle...".

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Poor, yeah.

turns.speaker: BOBBY CLOWES
turns.text: But not you.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: We have a commission. If there's a dispute over territory, the commission decides.

turns.speaker: BOO-BOO HOFF
turns.text: Tell me something, Meyer. How can you get up at dawn to walk on the beach if you're on your honeymoon?

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: The commission don't decide how I spend my honeymoon.

turns.speaker: BOO-BOO HOFF
turns.text: Hey, I ignore my wife too. But on our honeymoon I paid attention.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Boo-Boo.

turns.speaker: BOO-BOO HOFF
turns.text: Not another word.

turns.speaker: CAPONE
turns.text: Up here, Boss.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: That ain't exactly been the lucky spot lately.

turns.speaker: CAPONE
turns.text: But from now on it's Lucky's spot.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Maybe you better hear what I got to say first.

turns.speaker: CAPONE
turns.text: Whatever you say, Boss.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: No, Al. Whatever we say. We're all Bosses here. We don' need another.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Why should you be payin' me when we're all equals?

turns.speaker: CAPONE
turns.text: You scare me, Charlie.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Maybe that's why I'm the Boss.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: Are you frightened?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Why should I be?

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: I had everything. Once.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: So what happened?

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: Life knocked me back.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I came into this world flat on my ass.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: And now you have everything.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No. Not everything.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: Up down. Down up. It's the same. You see things through both eyes.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I guess I am. Just a little.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Scared.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: When my money moves, I go with it.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: I trust Mr. Johnson filled you in on the revisions.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: Scotch is a very valuable commodity these days.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Mr. Rothstein, Can I be frank? You're a gambler, and I know you've had losses. I also know you could sell to Maranzano or Masseria for fifty G's, but nobody sells to those guys once. So if ya really got another buyer, and ya wanna welch, I ain't gonna beef.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I ain't mad. I ain't even surprised. But I can't let ya fuck me. On the other hand, if ya got needs beyond the thirty-five, I'll advance it to you against our next deal on the same terms.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: Could we step outside?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I got my partner in there!

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: I cannot bear to look at that hideous suit one minute more.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Their asses are here, but their fuckin' heads are still in Sicily.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: Precisely. We are the true entrepreneurs, and Prohibition is the greatest opportunity we shall ever have. America is begging to be taken like an overripe virgin, but they're still fighting over the crumbs of Little Italy.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: We'll start small. When we got 'em lined up, we increase the supply a bit at a time. Only sell the best stuff. And keep the price high, 'cause ya know how folks hate the taste of cheap booze.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: An intelligent plan, Mr. Luciano, but listen to me well. It can be ruined in a single careless moment. Keep your feet on the ground and your high opinion of yourself under your hat.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Don't worry. I got friends to take care of that.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: When the stiff's an Irish, the cops take it kinda personal.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Can't we get a couple whores over?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Four-twenty-eight.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: What's that divided four ways?

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Tommy Reina. Good pal. Better partner.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: From your mouth ta God's ear.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: He's got a line on the good stuff.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: We could lose the deal!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: If we have to.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE MULLAVEY
turns.text: They told me you wanted to talk about this Shane business.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You havin' any luck findin' out who did him?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE MULLAVEY
turns.text: Shane was a friend of yours?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: He was around...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE MULLAVEY
turns.text: Lad, I'm a busy man. July's always a big month for murder. Fella named Barone turned up just this mornin', throat cut ear to ear.  Black Hand.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: When you're investigatin', how long ya keep at it?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE MULLAVEY
turns.text: It consoles the bereaved family ta see the perpetrator take his load of juice. We try to oblige.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: But if ya can't catch the guys...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: But Maranzano's got the men and the brains.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Which is why he doesn't need us.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Bastard didn't even show.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: He's hidin'. Word's out Tommy Reina's goin' over ta Maranzano.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Get word to Maranzano. I want a meet. Alone. On neutral turf.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Masseria's confused. He can't figure whether you're workin' for Maranzano, or gettin' ready to kill the bastard. So he's spreadin' the word that you're goin' after Profaci because it happened on his turf. I figure Masseria's gonna try to rub out Profaci, and pin it on us. Then Maranzano will have to kill ya.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You got men on Profaci's place?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: We got our boys paintin' the house next door. Around the clock. We're gonna keep old man Profaci alive if it takes twenty coats.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Masseria's tryin' ta find a way around ya. But his patience won't hold out much longer.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: How's Bugsy doin'?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Tommy Reina's hauntin' his dreams. But he'll do his job.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Mad Dog Coll's in town on a job.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Who hired the bastard?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Maranzano. Ta ice you.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: How much longer we gotta be shut up in this fuckin' sweatbox?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Long as Charlie says.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You ain't even a man yet.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: That ain't what your mama said.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Where'd ya get this funny ravioli?

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Ya ignorant Guinea, it's kreplach.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No disrespect, Tommy, but why would Mr. Arnold Rothstein wanna do business with bums like us?

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Why ya always gotta go lookin' for a gift in the mouth of the horse?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I think Maranzano's talkin' a hell of a deal.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Sure, Frankie. Fuck me. Fuck Meyer. Fuck Arnold Rothstein who's made us all rich. All so you can be an fuckin' honorary Sicilian!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Does Maranzano have to kiss you on the lips before you'll take his goddamn money?

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: If he's gonna fuck me up the ass!

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: The deal's too good, Frankie

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What are ya thinkin', Charlie?

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: A hundred-seven bucks too much. Any kid who drops an extra dime is gonna be talkin' to Moliari.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Ya mean we're so rich we're broke?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Mr. Costello handles our business with the government agencies.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm sorry, but I sleep better when I know I'm with the winning side.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: We're gonna be the winning side. It's like Rothstein said about that guy in Austria. We're gonna use Maranzano and Masseria. Let 'em knock each other bloody. And then, when everybody's screamin' for peace, we step in to make it. What they're fight in' over, everybody will beg us to take.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I thought we just wanted to be left alone to run our business.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: Inside, they were talking of you.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I can just imagine.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: No. They envy you.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: For being a bootlegger?

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: For being a man.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You here with Bobby?

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: No. I'm here with you.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: I must be going.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Come on. It's Christmas. At least stay for breakfast.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: I'm already late.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Luciano.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: I was calling yesterday.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Something came up.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: I needed to see you again.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Same here.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: You're sure?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Why do you bother with perfume when you smell like this?

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: It's a mask.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You got something to hide?

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: It's too late.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Have you thought about this?

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: Why? You're the innocent one.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Guess I'm too confused to think.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: You could have stopped him.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Ya never tell a guy about a broad.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: So you all make the same mistakes?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Gives us something in common.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: I booked passage to London.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: London?

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: My friends have a country house we can use for a while.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: If I look weak now, it's over.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: I'm very sorry... I didn't...

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Oh, God. Don't start actin' like a fuckin' wife on me.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: A lot of shit came out of me in the hospital. I'm sorry you got hit by it.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: You must be feeling better, if you're looking for sex again.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: Would it be painful for you?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: It always is.

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: Charlie?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I'm doin' business here!

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: But there's...

turns.speaker: GAY ORLOVA
turns.text: I'm gonna lose you, Charlie.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: It'll all be over tomorrow. No more wars. No more killin'. Just livin' normal like everybody else.  You'll be stuck with me for good.

turns.speaker: JOE PROFACI
turns.text: Charlie!

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I do this for you, and you'll leave me and my guys alone. Be the fuckin' Boss of all the other Bosses, but we are gonna be our own Bosses.

turns.speaker: JOE PROFACI
turns.text: Come on, Charlie. We gotta have a top guy. Otherwise these wars ain't never gonna stop.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: As long as ya got one top Boss, somebody else's always gonna be looking to knock him off. And that's war on top of war.

turns.speaker: JOE PROFACI
turns.text: Who'll make the rules?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: We'll make 'em, and we'll enforce 'em. All of us. Together. We all get one vote. Includin' me.

turns.speaker: JOE PROFACI
turns.text: Charlie, I'm from the old country, and these American ways get me sometimes confused. You tellin' us you refuse the title of Boss of All the Bosses?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I don't care what anybody calls me, Joe. Long as it ain't to dirty. And if you fellas get together every year and say, "Charlie, we still want you to run things for us", I ain't gonna insult ya by sayin' no.

turns.speaker: JOE PROFACI
turns.text: Julius Caesar never took no vote.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: And maybe that's why he ended up dead in the streets of Rome.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You fellas got names?

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Lansky. Meyer Lansky. And that's Bugsy Siegel ya got there.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Meyer just finished the books.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: A million bucks. In the last six months.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Bugsy, you and I don't need to be in business with Maranzano. We got more jobs than we can handle. That's not the problem.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: So what is the problem?

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: The minute we sell out to Maranzano, that bastard is gonna have you knocked off.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: We'll figure out something.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I'm supposed to be at my old man's for Christmas dinner at eight.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: At least Masseria plays by the rules. Maranzano thinks he's God, and the rules don't apply.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Without us, Masseria don't stand a chance, and he knows it.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Meyer.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: It's nothin'. I'm gettin' married.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Married? To Anna?  You ain't got her in trouble?

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: No. We ain't even...

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Well, good. Woman like that you don't have to keep an eye on.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Guess I'm not a single type guy.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Whatta ya mean? It's great!

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: We're going to Atlantic City for the honeymoon.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I'll talk to Nucky. Get you set up like the fuckin' Prince of Wales.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: I been thinkin'...

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Good. 'Cause every time you start thinkin', we end up makin' money.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: We need to put together a meet for the whole country. We all got the same problems. We could talk. Meet the guys we don't know. Lift a few with the guys we do.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Like a party for all our friends.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Italians, Jews, Irish. One big party. Course, some guys don't get along.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Like Don Maranzano.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: And if we don't invite Maranzano, we can't invite Masseria. Guys don't wanna be choosin' sides.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I'll handle the Boss.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: So we end up with everybody but the two Bosses, at our meet. We ain't sayin' we're the leaders, but we're leadin'.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: How soon can we pull this off?

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: I'm gettin' married in six weeks. I'll already be in Atlantic City which is probably the best place to do it anyway.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Your honeymoon, Meyer?

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Might as well put the time to use.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: After all this time I'd think you'd know me better, Meyer.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: It's not myself I'm worried about.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I'll do fine.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: You're getting' 10 cc's

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I told you twenty!

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You bastards, I said twenty!

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: It'll just be a few minutes.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I NEED THE TWENTY!

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Tommy Reina's gone over to Maranzano, but so far Masseria ain't lifted a finger,

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: The fat man's scared. Scared of us, and scared without us. Same with Maranzano. We gotta get their minds back on each other. This fuckin' peace is killin' us.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: We can get the war started tomorrow, but it won't be pretty.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Tommy Reina.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Meyer, ain't anybody ever told you ya look more like a bookkeeper than a fuckin' mobster?

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: What's your problem?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: It's just that Maranzano's the only bastard I ever heard brag about gettin' audited by the IRS. He came out clean, so he thinks his shit don't stink.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Is there a fuckin' point comin' up anytime soon?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Seein' he loved the experience so much, I think we outta give him the pleasure again.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Yeah. So who the fuck does?

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Come on. Tell us, Shitface.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Come off it, Bugs.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Come off it, Bugs.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Ben-jamin.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: We got exactly two choices, Maranzano or Masseria.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: They don't give a shit about us!

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: What you mean? Tommy ain't done nothin'.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Maranzano will think Masseria ordered the hit, and won't have no choice but to start the war.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Why's it gotta be Tommy!

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: Masseria won't have any choice but to trust you. And as long as we keep the Boss alive, Maranzano can't win without you.

turns.speaker: LANSKY
turns.text: We're gonna change it, Bugs. Once we get rid of the Dons, the Commission's gonna rule. No more wars. No more vendettas. No more Boss of All the Bosses.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Yeah. And no more Tommy Reina.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: If ever I need a Boss, Joe.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah. I bet ya feed Maranzano that same line.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: I like that.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Whatta ya mean, Boss?

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: Ya piss like a man.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: I'm glad ya come.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: What's with the banquet? This is supposed to be a private meet.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: It's only us and Sonny. Hey, Sonny. Come on out.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: You boys carryin' pieces?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You tryin' ta tell me something? I don't come to a meet with a weapon unless it's with an enemy.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: See if these two are my friends.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: You're a smart boy, Charlie, but there's somethin' you ain't learned yet. A man needs a family.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I know. When the storm hits, it don't pay to be caught outside.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: I got a place for you. In my family... or in the cemetery.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Never threaten me, Boss.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: This business is about taking risks.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Calculated risks. But Boss, this one don't calculate.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: Tommy tells me that Capone's coming in from Chicago.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: He's trying to make it.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: He'll think something's wrong I ain't there.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: He'll know you were smart enough to stay away, Boss.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: What the fuck does that mean?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You know that if you come, we gotta invite Maranzano.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: So fuck him. I don't care anymore. Let him come.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: So he can talk to all the families behind your back? Maybe have his own meet at 3:00 AM under the goddamn boardwalk? No. You're too smart for a sucker play.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Where we headed?

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: Wassa matter, Mr. Big Shot. Don't have time for my business no more?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Boss, I got all the time you need.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: I know about you.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: And what went on your little party in Atlantic City. I got ears.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: That little party's gonna make you a lotta money.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: MONEY DON'T MEAN SHIT!

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Didn't know you felt that way.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: You and Vito are gonna pull that payroll job. Right now.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You gotta plan these things.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: And I got it all planned.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: If I wanted ta kill ya, I woulda done it long ago. It's not like you ain't given me reason.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: I'm still the Boss of All the Bosses! And you'll do what I say!

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: So tell me when I ain't done it.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: How can I trust you when you look at me like that?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You got no fuckin' choice. You might be able to stay alive, but you're never gonna win the war from these fuckin' rat holes.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: Tell me, Charlie. Please.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Why should I go against you, Boss? Nobody can handle this business like you. Maranzano'll never know the crap that you forget. He's got no business bein' Boss. The idea makes me wanna puke. You're the Boss, an it's gonna stay that way.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: What are ya thinkin'?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Joe Profaci. Carlo Gambino. Vinnie Mangano. Joe Bananas. They all gotta die.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: You can't fuck with them. They're heads of families!

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: They're friends of our enemy.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: Take one of 'em out, and they'll all line up against us.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Not if they all die at once.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Every successor will owe his loyalty to us. Together we take out Maranzano, and each family gets a piece of his operation.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: A mother-fuckin' peace conference.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: We gotta talk in private. I got a friend in Coney Island who's gonna open his restaurant just for us.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: But that's an hour's drive.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Lobster Fra Diavolo. Spaghetti with red clam sauce. Antipasto. And pastry that'll make you wanna go home and slap your sweet mama.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Ya did good. I ain't seen the Boss so happy in weeks.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: Look at this boy. He hardly eats. Like that fella killed Caesar.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: When ya got all that blood workin' in your belly, it ain't upstairs where it needs to be.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: The kid just called me stupid.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Not stupid. Fat.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: Shit. When I was comin' up, bein' fat meant ya had somethin' ta eat. Guy looked like you, people felt sorry for 'em. Right, Gerardo?
